reviewText: As expected.  I have heard where a third season of this  series on WGN has been canceled.  That is a shame, though any student of history knows how it ended.  Only thing still hanging is the future of the characters.  Thank you for fast service and delivery.
Great

The two season mini series is well written and acted. The atmosphere, politics and tension feels authentic. Robert Oppenheimer is a minor character and Gen. Leslie Groves is not included. Niels Bohr is a cameo role. There are plenty of spies and military police. There are a few soap opera side issues. Overall extremely well done.
Just finished watching this and it's every bit as good as the first season, now I need to watch it again.
Interesting take on that part of history.
I love this show and hope there will be a season 3. Great acting and suspense.

Excellent! Great script, excellent acting. Yes it has "hollywood trappings" i.e. many of the nurses are prostitutes on the side, one lesbian relationship goes on w/ one star character. Those things might turn off the real WWII vets but gotta do it to compete w/ today's TV. There is no Interpol in 1943 but so what. And for the prop master, I did catch a mistake. I happened to pause "a diner scene" and what do I see but a post year 2000 stainless steel tea dispenser in a 1943 diner. HA! Bet I'm the only one to catch that one. And some gripe the uniforms are off. WWII vet's way in on this? Nevertheless. Ignore the mistakes and just fall in love with these characters that are as genius as the characters in Mad Men. Actually this is Mad Men in the desert! The show sends me to Google constantly looking for "Nuclear Science for Dummies!" Serious. I've learned so much about how "the gadget" actually works due to this genius TV mini-series drama. Oh one more for the prop master. I can't resist even though I'm a huge fan. Notice the electrical power lines. The crew only made it about 200' long. If you watch the cars and jeeps go down the dirt road, the power line abruptly ends. Caught ya. HA again. But guess the budget had it's limits. I understand.

Already have both seasons on Amazon Instant Video, as well as Season 1 on Blu-ray.  Season 2 was even better, and now is on order!  Hoping for a third season...I am very anxious to see how the scientists and their families are impacted, emotionally and professionally, by the bomb's successful test and imminent use in war.  An outstanding fictional melodrama based on the bomb, rich in period detail.

WGN's Manhattan is one of the best period pieces in the last decade
It's also one of the most overlooked

It runs circles around Mad Men

If you enjoyed season one for what it is and don't over analyse the story
You'll love season two
Three new cast members make guest appearances in season two
 William Petersen  (Col. Emmett Darrow)  This is one of the first times i hated a character Peterson has played mostly cause Col. Darrow is in no way a good person
Mamie Gummer  (Nora) This is a different role for Mamie it's very dark
Neve Campbell  (Kitty Oppenheimer)

The two major negatives about season two
 Frank Winter  ( John Benjamin Hickey) isn't in enough of this season mostly cause this season is the story of other key characters from season one
The other negative would be the way the season is constructed
The opening of season two is 45 minutes before the season finale
Then it goes backwards a year before the night they test the bomb
During this season there are glimpses into that night with new clues and info being thrown at you!
(This is by no means as manic and confusing as Legends Season two) But, it messes up the flow of everything going on
If you thought you knew any of these characters after the end of season one
You'll be surprised there's a lot of interesting backstory to everyone
Rachel Brosnahan  (Abby Isaacs)
Christopher Denham  (Jim Meeks)
Olivia Williams  (Liza Winter)
Harry Lloyd  (Paul Crosley)
Ashley Zukerman  (Charlie Isaacs)
These 5 actors are  phenomenal and add so much quality to the story

This is one of those series that holds a mirror at "us" living in 2015/2016
It has a deep and very dark social commentary
These real scientist wanted to have powers like a God and look where the world ended up
World War II wasn't the last major war
We are no better from that time up until now
Nothing has really changed for the greater good/better
If you love American history this series is amazing the production values on all the authentic clothes, hair, music  and everything in between
is awe inspiring it's like going into a time machine  10/10
All great.
Mucho grande boom!  Great series.
Kinda drags and is confusing......
A excellent series showing gross stupidly by the USA military. Some sections were a waste of time but overall it was ok to watch
teriffic series amd very topical considering todays world
Good Continuation of the show
Not the bomb, but it's about the bomb. Good entertainment.
great
One of my favorite shows - thanks.

My wife and I really liked Season 1 of Manhattan.  It had all sorts of things going for it: intrigue, history, science and secrecy.  Season 2 however, doesn't fare so well.  It's all over the board with too many sidebar stories to make it cohesive.  The central story is still the development and subsequent building and testing of the first atomic bomb.  Substories include Oppenheimer's mistress, lesbian lovers, several murders, a couple who-dunnits and treason.

The acting is mostly solid with the best performance by one of the most unlikely cast members, Michael Chernus, who plays Louis 'Fritz' Fedowitz.  From the moment he enters the scene to the last scene of the series he is the most believable of all the characters.  There are many suppositions to this series but mostly it's enjoyable.  Certainly, Season One stands out as a winner with Season Two closing the door, never to open again.
Terrible.  The series was cancelled after this season and unfortunately I can see why. I think the writers must have been on vacation.
Enjoyable perspecitive on this historical event/project.

This is one of the most fascinating and enjoyable series I have viewed in the last few years.  It is terrific fiction within the constraints of what really happened in the development of the atomic bomb.  The ethical and moral issues, the stress on all the scientists, the tension with the military--all provide an exciting, and totally unpredictable action line.  We liked it so much, instead of watching one episode a night as we ususall do, some evenings we watch two and once three,  It was too exciting to stop.
Wish there had been a Season 3.  Interesting presentation.  Don't know how historically accurate, but that doesn't take away from the story.  Not sure why this had fewer viewers than Season 1.
Bummed it's only two seasons!

My wife and I watched both seasons of 'Manhattan' on Hulu. We are both in agreement that this short lived series is among the finest to have ever aired on TV. The writing and acting in this show, is about as good as it gets.

Since I have a great interest in, and have read a lot of books on the Manhattan Project, I was thrilled to discover that this series had been made. The show is absolutely riveting, and is so interesting, that each episode seems to go by in an instant.

With so many mediocre shows on TV, it's sad when a series of this caliber gets cancelled, due to low ratings. With that said, I'm happy that I was at least able to watch with thorough delight, the 23 episodes that were produced.

If you like period pieces, and have any interest in the lives of those who participated in the Manhattan Project, you'll no doubt agree that this is among the finest shows of this type ever made. The lives of the scientists, their families, and the secrets they had to keep, make for an epic storyline.

Living in the middle of the New Mexico desert, working on the most highly classified project in the world, certainly took its toll on all those involved. The manner in which the lives of all are intertwined, and the incredible acting performances by all, make you feel as if you're part of the actual scene.

This is a TV series not to be missed. In addition to the outstanding writing and acting, the cinematography is simply breathtaking. In addition, the automobiles of the 1930's and 1940's are interesting in their own right. I cannot recommend a TV series any higher than this. It just doesn't get any better.

The bottom line is that 'Manhattan', will leave you wanting for more. After you finish watching this series, it will take a while to find something else worth your time. This is one of those shows, like 'Breaking Bad,' where everything you watch afterwards is a letdown. That's how great it is.
great show!
I loved it! Too bad it did not get enough viewers for one more season.
What a letdown compared to the first season. It's like they run out of all ideas.

In Season 2 of Manhattan tension is rising now the scientific team has to overcome problems in the development of an atomic bomb, while the army starts interfering even more in their daily affairs. Manhattan is a must for everybody interested in one of the major historic events that took place in the 20th century. Director Shaw really gave a heart to all who contributed to this project, and the acting of the cast is wonderful. Existing and fiction characters come to life in this great show.
It could have been much better if it was allowed to mature over four or five seasons. I HATE FOCUS GROUPS.I think they killed the show which had a lot more stories to tell.
Guess this is over. Disappointing.
I like this series. Lots of suspense and drama. Well acted.

Although I feel a lot of things were added to make the story more interesting I found it very entertaining and interesting to imagine how the scientists possibly had to work on making the bomb and troubles with personalities they had.  The actors were very good.
No bonus features. No real ending to a great show.
It's a interesting series.  I purchased it because the series is not shown on broadcast tv where I live.
While I am disappointed by the cancellation of the series the story was wrapped up in the last episode, enough to give it an ending I could live with.
A wonderful and accurate re-creation of the building of the people who built the first atomic bomb. Sad it was cut short when it had legs for at least two more seasons.

Buyer beware. This is a great show and I'm very sad to say that they cancelled it and they cancelled it on a cliffhanger. So just be warned that if you get into the story and characters you will be left alone after season 2 and it does not wrap things up
good show.
Great can hardly wait for season 3

Its not a spoiler to mention this show is canceled after 2 seasons. (there is nothing to spoil here) This is for the show and not the people who really lived it. The wife liked it and I watched it with her. Slow moving, contrived production and if there is any basis in fact, its a miracle we won the war based on what we saw here. That said, it should be noted that I have the most respect and sincere thanks for the real people who led the real effort and sacrificed so much for our freedom!.
Manhattan season two was just as good as season one and I really did like it also.

If I were rating just Season 1, I would have rated this 3 stars. But Season 2 is simply ridiculous. Do the writers know anything about science, or scientists? Or the project itself (of which Manhattan was only one of 3 prongs)? A history-changing "gadget" is being built, but among all the soap opera, there's NOBODY ACTUALLY BUILDING THE BOMB!  Season 1 at least allowed for artistic license in that there was some relationship to actual events. Why do writers bother to try to connect with an actual event when they run so far afield of it for the sake of soap-opera theatrics that it insults the truth far too much to be called "artistic license". The real shame is that the truth, such that it is known anyway, is a very interesting story on its own.

I fully enjoyed this season as I did the first season.  Directors stayed on track trying to keep the show from wandering away from a little education about the problems during the invention of the first atomic weapon.
I can't wait for season 3.
A good show.
It was good, it allowed you to follow from season one
Dull and disconnected

The discs come in plastic snap cases. They play fine.

The Manhattan series is terrific. I love period shows that take a little history and make it dramatic fiction, in other words, they breathe life into the subject, make it interesting. If you like Manhattan (2014-2015) you might like Granite Flats (2013-2015) or Taken (2002). All three series are set during WWII or shortly after. They are about secret government programs. Manhattan is about making the first atomic bomb, like the movie Fat Man and Little Boy (1989). Taken is about UFOs and alien visitors, sort of a fictionalized version of Project Blue Book. And Granite Flats is about the experimental drug program MKUltra (the CIA mind control program).

All three series have great story arcs. They start and finish strong and have great middles. One difference is the smoking and drinking. There is smoking and drinking in almost every scene in Manhattan, which was set during the era when soldiers received packs of cigarettes with their meal rations. Ever been around a chain smoker? In Taken theres a scene where Crawford says his doctor prescribed cigarettes for hypertension. Imagine that. I don't remember any smoking in Granite Flats, but that might just be my poor memory.

If the above don't sound interesting you might like a couple of space race shows. I spent a month on a space race binge. First I read Space by James A. Michener. Then I watched two movies, The Right Stuff (1983) and Apollo 13 (1995), and then two great series, From Earth to the Moon (1998) and The Astronauts Wives Club (2015). Theyre a great combination.

If the above shows don't sound interesting here are a few of the series I really enjoyed watching more than once. I love good miniseries like Band of Brothers (2001), Frank Herberts Dune (2000), Into the West (2005), Lonesome Dove (1989), Pride and Prejudice (1995), Taken (2002) and The 10th Kingdom (2000) because they have beginnings, middles and endings, like a good novel.

Other shows Ive really enjoyed include Battlestar Galactica (2004-2009), Breaking Bad (2008-2013), Cowboy Bebop (1998), Downton Abbey (2010-2015), Firefly (2002), Game of Thrones (2011-2019), The IT Crowd (2006-2013), Jericho (2006-2008), Lost (2004-2010), Merlin (2008-2012), Rome (2005-2007), Spartacus: Gods of the Arena (2011), Spartacus: Blood and Sand (2010), Stargate: SG-1 (1997-2007), Stargate: Atlantis (2004-2009), Star Trek The Original Series (1966-1969) and Star Trek Voyager (1995-2001). I didn't list any contemporary series Im following that don't have an end date yet, not conducive to binge watching from beginning to finish, or the hundreds of other fantasy and science fiction shows Ive watched.

If you like reading try some of my favorite fantasy and sci-fi authors: Richard Adams, Palo Bacigulupi, Suzanne Collins, Abe Evergreen, Diana Gabaldon, Hugh Howey, George Martin, Brandon Sanderson, John Scalzi, and Andy Weir.
Loved this show, second season seemed rushed, maybe they knew they were being cancelled and wanted to finish things up. Would have loved another couple seasons.
A first class TV series. Unusual and memorable DVD in excellent condition , from a good seller

I really wish WGN would have kept this going another season or so or that Netflix would pick it up. Sure it wasn't historically accurate all the time (Okay most of the time) but it was still an enjoyable series. The characters were likeable onscreen even when they weren't always likeable. Thankfully they did release Season Two on DVD.

About as historically  accurate as Hogans Hero's was to WW 2 prisoner of war life. The writers and producers just made crap up to further the soap opera sense. Seems that every major physicist was mentally ill, every married person an adulterer and every military member a brainwashed lunatic.
Wildly inaccurate historical nonsense.

The story of the men and women who created America's atomic bomb under the Manhattan Project during WWII is still as fascinating as season one. The greatest collection of scientists, engineers and technicians in America were placed in a secret city in the middle of the New Mexican desert so secret that the city didn't even have a name. Not even the streets had street signs. I'm always surprised how few people know anything about the Manhattan Project and , hopefully, shows as well done as this one help. A very well done drama series.
I loved the storyline about the development of the bomb and have watched the DVD several times.  I  could deal without the soap opera carp.
Gotta love this made-for-TV series.  Waiting for the two additional "encore" shows to appear.
Just wished that had more seasons ...
the best
